thread.title: Don’t let End of Life Option Act ignore good end-of-life care
thread.title_full: Don’t let End of Life Option Act ignore good end-of-life care - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Ryan F. Holmes
title: Don’t let End of Life Option Act ignore good end-of-life care
text:
Photo: Rich Pedroncelli, Associated Press Gov. Jerry Brown signs bills with Graciela Castillo-Krings, his deputy legislative secretary, Oct. 9. Gov. Jerry Brown signs bills with Graciela Castillo-Krings, his...
Many celebrate the End of Life Option Act, ABx2 15 , as a great thing for patient autonomy. But as we enter a new era of medicine in California, we should remember the concerns of those who opposed its passage. It would be a shame if an unintended consequence of this new law is a loss of focus on palliative care and hospice for patients. Gov. Jerry Brown signs bills with Graciela Castillo-Krings, his deputy legislative secretary, Oct. 9. Gov. Jerry Brown signs bills with Graciela Castillo-Krings, his...
Many celebrate the End of Life Option Act, ABx2 15 , as a great thing for patient autonomy. But as we enter a new era of medicine in California, we should remember the concerns of those who opposed its passage. It would be a shame if an unintended consequence of this new law is a loss of focus on palliative care and hospice for patients.
